definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

pinyin: gong1 gong4 zhi1 shi5 fen4 zi3

sentences.english: The first one probes into intellectual psychology of Sun li in liberated area of period mainly.
sentences.chinese: 第一章主要探討孫犁在解放區時期的知識分子心態。

sentences.english: The study of Marxism-Leninism will arm the intellectuals ideologically.
sentences.chinese: 學習馬列主義將從思想上武裝知識分子。

sentences.english: For both the left and right this means anti-intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 不管左派右派，這就代表反知識分子。

sentences.english: The erroneous attitude of not respecting intellectuals must be opposed.
sentences.chinese: 要反對不尊重知識分子的錯誤思想。
呂弗勒是我認識的一個花瓶一樣的知識分子。

sentences.english: Prophetic intellects began to think of themodernization of country China.
sentences.chinese: 先知先覺的知識分子開始了鄉土中國現代化的思考。

sentences.english: He likes to set himself up as an intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡自命爲知識分子。

sentences.english: Yan Zhen's novels focus on the spiritual plight of intellectuals.
sentences.chinese: 閻真的小說專注於對知識分子精神困境的刻畫。

sentences.english: Many of our local Party branches are still reluctant to let intellectuals join.
sentences.chinese: 許多地方黨部，還不願意吸收知識分子入黨。

sentences.english: A group of higher or middle rank intellectuals have been admitted into the Party.
sentences.chinese: 一批優秀的高中級知識分子被吸收入黨。

sentences.english: This way, they could kill off all the intellectuals of the society.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，他就可以對全社會的知識分子大開殺戒了。

sentences.english: Personality structure of intellectuals are explored based on the hypothesis of lexicology.
sentences.chinese: 採用詞彙學假設，探討了知識分子的人格結構。

sentences.english: Liang Ding Fen was a representative of the intellectuals in the Late Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 梁鼎芬是晚清知識分子的典型代表。

sentences.english: It was said that Teacher Zhang graduated from Qinghua University, a typical intellectual image.
sentences.chinese: 據說張老師是清華畢業，純正的知識分子形象。

sentences.english: The room for honest speaking is far greater than Russian intellectuals make use of.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯知識分子並未利用誠實立言的自由。

definition: to imbue with/to inculcate/to instill into/to teach/to impart/to channel water to another place
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
